There are $n$ countries connected by $n-1$ directed roads.  Each road goes from one country to another.  You can think of the countries as numbered 1 through $n$.  

Two people want to rule the world.  Each person can choose a country to rule.  If a person rules a country, they also control all the other countries that can be reached by following the roads from their chosen country.

The people can rule the world if and only if there are at most two countries that they choose to rule, and every other country is controlled by at least one of them.

The people can change the direction of some roads.  What is the minimum number of roads they need to change so that they can rule the world?

You are given a network of connected cities.  Some roads have a direction.  Two people want to control the network so that every city is controlled by at least one of them. They can change the direction of some roads. Find the minimum number of roads they need to change.
